underlying_goal: To systematically verify if the previously discovered lie detector confound applies to all 10 trained variants of the detector.
primary_success: Systematically executed a comprehensive experimental plan to test 10 different classifier variants for a known confound, including generating data, writing an analysis script, and documenting the results, ultimately verifying that 9/10 detectors were confounded.
brief_summary: Following up on a previous finding, the user asked Claude to verify if a known lie detector confound affected all 10 variants. Claude designed and executed a systematic experiment, running each detector on both same-model and mixed-model data. It then wrote a script to analyze the 20 resulting data files, confirming that 9/10 detectors were indeed confounded, and updated the project's documentation and slides with these definitive results.
